intro: Racosperma divergens, commonly known as the slender wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes and is characterized by its pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. It produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are often accompanied by distinctive, finely hairy stems. Racosperma divergens is adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in dry, open habitats.
